metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15784 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Secure Reliable Transport (SRT) through 1.3.4 has a CSndUList array overflow if there are many SRT connections.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsrt1 - 1.4.0-1
srt-tools - 1.4.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: srt package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.0-1').
